attributes.action: Ban social media access to children under the age of 16
attributes.additional_details: Social media should be banned for under-16s to protect mental health, safety, and development. Platforms fuel anxiety, addiction, and low self-esteem, expose children to cyberbullying and exploitation, and harm focus and sleep. Young users can’t fully grasp data privacy or online risks. A ban lets teens mature, build real-world skills, and use social media responsibly later.
attributes.background: Government to ban children from using social media platforms until the age of 16 and issue penalties to social media providers who allow children to access the platforms.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action: 

Ban social media for under-16s to protect children
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/710283
